metadata.case_name: Major E. G. Barsay v. State of Maharashtra
metadata.case_number: Criminal Appeal No. 2 of 1958 and Criminal Appeal No. 81 of 1960

facts.text: Dehu Vehicle Depot stored military stores; Col. Rao was Chief Ordnance Officer, subordinate to Col. Sindhi and Brig. Wilson.
Accused No. 1, Major Barsay, was second in command and in charge of stores section, subordinate to Col. Rao.
Major Nag in charge of administration; Capt. Pratap Singh Security Officer, but Lawrence acting as Security Officer.
Accused No. 2 Kochhar recalled from leave Oct 25, 1954, posted to kit stores by Accused No. 1.
Accused No. 3 Avatar Singh transferred from Unfit Sub Park to Kit Stores by Accused No. 1 during Col. Rao's absence.

Accused No. 4 Saighal, ex-Colonel, stayed near Depot; Accused No. 5 Ramchand Gangwani ran hotel at Lonavala; Accused No. 6 Devichand and absconding Khemchand sons of No. 5; Nos. 4 and 5 partners in Bombay Lonavala Disposal Syndicate.
Large consignments of unitemized kits in Shed No. 48.
Accused conspired to smuggle stores from Depot for illegal gain via Accused No. 4; brain behind was Accused No. 1.
Plan: Smuggling during Col. Rao's leave (Dec 11, 1954); Barsay to act as Chief Ordnance Officer.
Theft in Unfit Park night of Dec 1, 1954; Accused No. 1 suggested to Lawrence smuggling scheme, hinted Col. Rao suspected him.
Scheme confirmed by Accused No. 2; plan involved board for itemization Shed 17, shuttle trucks to move stores out disguised as back-loaded to Return Stores Sub-Depot.
Plan delayed due to Capt. Kapoor visits; meeting Dec 18, 1954 at Barsay's bungalow: Accused 1-4 and Lawrence finalized Dec 20 plan.
Kochhar briefed Jamadar Kundanlal; Lawrence detailed him to main gate; Barsay to allot driver Ramban.
Dec 19 evening: Lawrence saw transshipment spot at Saighal's; went to Depot, learned Kundanlal sick; Barsay sent chit.
Dec 20, 9:15 am: Barsay allotted new vehicle D-5963 with driver Ramban to Kit Stores.
10 am: Barsay ordered Lawrence in Maj. Nag presence to get fire hoses from Dehu OD.
Lawrence informed Barsay Kundanlal sick, Godse at gate; Barsay suggested Jamadar Jogendrasingh replace.
11 am: Barsay confirmed scheme on schedule; truck loaded ordinary stores first to Shed 26, then valuable; bogus voucher/gate-pass.
Lawrence ordered Jogendrasingh to main gate, gave written order not to enter vehicle.
1 pm: Barsay apprehensive due to Station Commandant car, delayed; truck proceeded 1:40 pm, Lawrence in truck.
At gate, Jogendrasingh said Barsay message not to proceed; Lawrence ignored, took truck out.
Truck to spot near Talegaon; civilian lorry BYL 3289 ready by Accused 4,5,6; transshipping started, police intervened.
Lawrence joined conspiracy to expose culprits, informed superiors/police.
Defence: Lawrence concocted scheme to improve reputation amid thefts.
Special Judge convicted all 1-6 under s.120B IPC, s.5(2) PCA r/w s.34 IPC.
Bombay HC confirmed conviction of 1 and 4, acquitted 2,3,5,6; altered some charges.
Accused No.4 died post HC judgment.

legal_issues.text: Whether Special Judge had jurisdiction to try offences or exclusive Court Martial jurisdiction under Army Act.
Validity of sanction under s.6(1)(a) Prevention of Corruption Act and s.197 CrPC.
Legality of investigation by Inspector Jog under s.5A Prevention of Corruption Act without conditions complied.
Framing of charges: Conspiracy including non-public servants under PCA; misjoinder.
Reliability of Lawrence's evidence as decoy/trap witness requiring corroboration.
Whether Accused No.1 implicated in conspiracy beyond reasonable doubt.

petitioner_arguments.text: Special Judge lacked jurisdiction; offences under Army Act s.52 exclusively triable by Court Martial; ss.125-126 not complied.
No valid sanction by Central Govt; order not in name of President per Art.77 Constitution.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Prevention of Corruption Act s.6(1)(a); Constitution Art.77

petitioner_arguments.text: Investigation illegal: Jog (Inspector) did not comply with proviso to s.5A PCA conditions (belief of evidence destruction, report to Magistrate).
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Prevention of Corruption Act s.5A; Delhi Special Police Establishment Act s.6

petitioner_arguments.text: Charges defective: Non-public servants (4-6) cannot be charged under PCA s.5(1)(c),(d); conspiracy invalid.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: IPC s.120A,120B; PCA s.5(1)(c),(d); CrPC s.537

petitioner_arguments.text: Lawrence unreliable decoy; evidence discrepant, reject in toto; no material corroboration implicating Accused No.1.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Sarwan Singh v. State of Punjab

respondent_arguments.text: Offences under IPC/PCA triable by Special Judge; Army Act concurrent jurisdiction, no exclusion; s.7 CLA Act exclusive.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Criminal Law Amendment Act 1952 s.7; Army Act ss.125-127

respondent_arguments.text: Sanction valid; Deputy Secretary competent per evidence.
Investigation irregularity no vitiation absent prejudice; consent under DSPE Act general valid.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: H.N. Rishbud v. State of Delhi

respondent_arguments.text: Charges sustainable; conspiracy valid even if not all liable for substantive; no prejudice.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: IPC s.120A; CrPC s.537; W. Slaney v. State of MP

respondent_arguments.text: Lawrence's evidence corroborated in material particulars; concurrent findings.

court_reasoning.text: Army Act does not exclude criminal court jurisdiction for civil offences also under Act; ss.125-126 resolve conflict; Special Judge exclusive under CLA s.7.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Concurrent jurisdiction; no decision for Court Martial, so Special Judge proceeds.

court_reasoning.text: Sanction valid; Deputy Secretary competent per evidence; Art.77 directory, substance matters.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Evidence proves order by appropriate authority.

court_reasoning.text: s.5A proviso conditions non-compliance illegal but no prejudice to accused; no failure of justice.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Per Rishbud, investigation irregularity does not vitiate trial absent miscarriage.

court_reasoning.text: Charges valid; conspiracy under s.120B ok even with non-public servants; alteration no prejudice per s.537 CrPC.
Lawrence partisan/decoy witness, not accomplice; requires corroboration but lower degree than tainted; evidence reliable, corroborated materially.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Broad story probable/true; not reject toto for some discrepancies.

court_reasoning.text: Concurrent findings: Accused No.1 party to conspiracy; no exceptional circumstances to interfere.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Evidence of postings, meetings, orders on Dec 20 corroborate.

holdings.text: Special Judge has jurisdiction notwithstanding Army Act.
Sanction and investigation valid, no vitiation.
Charges proper, no failure of justice.
Lawrence's evidence acceptable with corroboration; Accused No.1 guilty of conspiracy and criminal misconduct.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court rejected technical objections to jurisdiction, sanction, investigation, charges; upheld concurrent findings that Accused No.1 (Major Barsay) guilty of conspiracy and criminal misconduct based on corroborated evidence of Lawrence; appeal of Accused No.1 dismissed (text covers his appeal primarily).

key_quotes.text: "The Constitution does not require a magic incantation which can only be expressed in a set formula of words. What we have to see is whether the substance of the requirements is there."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "To convict an accused on the tainted evidence of an accomplice is not illegal but it is imprudent... in the case of a partisan witness... it would be necessary and advisable to look for corroboration."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "We, therefore, accept Lawrence's evidence, find that his story is probable and true and we also find that the evidence on the record justified the finding of the trial Court that there was a conspiracy."
key_quotes.speaker: lower_court
